description: From collaborator, from French collaborateur, from Latin collaborare. Displaced native Old English efnwyrÄ‹an.

verbs.description: collaborate (third-person singular simple present collaborates, present participle collaborating, simple past and past participle collaborated)

entries.meaning: To work together with others to achieve a common goal.
examples: Let's collaborate on this project, and get it finished faster.
Wikipedia is a website where anyone can collaborate.

entries.meaning: To voluntarily cooperate treasonably, as with an enemy occupation force in one's country.
examples: If you collaborate with the occupying forces, you will be shot.
